availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, priest. Native of Bavaria. Roman Catholic priest in Louisville in 1850. Roman Catholic priest in Louisville in 1860. Affiliated with the Female Academy of the Ursulines in Louisville in 1860. Priest at St. Martin’s Church in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 358A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 1, p. 127.
“Female Academy of the Ursulines in Louisville, Ky.,” Louisville Daily Courier, September 10, 1860.
Edwards’ Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, business Firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville for 1865-66 (Edwards, Greenough & Deved, Publishers), p. 492.
Find A Grave, "Leander Streber (1807-1882)," Memorial #93989053 , http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93989053 (accessed December 30, 2019).
